TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE his grandparents bought from the GPE municipality an apartment of QUANTITY in the centre of the city , which had become State property by virtue of the nationalisations carried out by the communist regime in GPE after DATE .
CARDINAL . After the death of the applicant 's grandparents his father inherited from them . In DATE he conveyed the property to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the heirs of the former pre - nationalisation owner of the apartment brought an action against the applicant 's father under section CARDINAL of LAW , arguing that his title to the property was null and void and seeking the restoration of their own title . They also brought a rei vindicatio action .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant 's father died and the applicant succeeded him in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The proceedings ended with a final judgment of ORG DATE . The courts allowed the plaintiffs ' claims , finding that the contract whereby the applicant 's grandparents had acquired the apartment had been null and void since the sale had not been approved by ORG , as required by the relevant provisions applicable at the time , but by his deputy .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE or DATE the applicant and his family vacated the apartment . In DATE they were granted the tenancy of a municipally - owned apartment at a regulated price , where they moved in .

CARDINAL . The applicant could apply to receive compensation bonds within DATE of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . However , he only applied for bonds on DATE . On DATE the regional governor dismissed the request as time - barred . On an appeal by the applicant , this decision was upheld by the courts .

CARDINAL . The relevant background facts , domestic law and practice have been summarised in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , GPE , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG , and CARDINAL , DATE .
